page.title: 05HOUSING EMMOTT'S FARM
page.content: Emmotts Farm is 450 years old. It was built in 1550 approximately. The whole family of the Beachamps who are living there now have been living there 83 years.The walls used to be made of Wattle and Daub but now have been changed to brick.The roof is made of tiles.It used to be thatched. The Beachamps don't know how many families have lived there.Mr Emmott brought Emmotts Farm in 1731 but never seemed to have lived there.Emmott's Farm house was 2 cottages until auctioned by descendants of Mr Emmott in 1872.Lord Radnor bought it.A man named Edmund Mack lived here in 1673 so we imagine this is why it is called Mack's lane.All the different animals that have been on the farm are horses,cattle,chickens,cats,dogs,and a rabbit.All the family have attended the local school.
